metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21963 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Connection Handling). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.40 and prior and 8.0.31 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 2.7 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-common - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
